intro: Pseudopinanga albescens, commonly known as the white-leafed haworthia, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically covered in a whitish or grayish powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, emerging from the center of the rosette. Pseudopinanga albescens is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
